Eugenio Faria Barbosa

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/0763835175495113
  • Última atualização do currículo em 06/05/2019

Doutorando e Mestrado (2017) em Nutrição de Ruminantes (Dairy Science) pela Universidade Federal de Lavras, sob orientação do Prof. Marcos Neves Pereira. Especialista em Reprodução de Bovinos Leiteiros pelo Rehagro (2013), Especialista em Nutrição de Bovinos Leiteiros pelo Rehagro (2010). Graduação em Medicina Veterinária pela Universidade de Uberaba (2008). Foi consultor técnico na Suporte Consultoria Pecuária Ltda, região de Bom Despacho e Passos - MG (Ago 2008 a Mai 2014). Tem experiência na área de nutrição de bovinos leiteiros: formulação de dietas, microbiologia do rúmen, digestão de amido, amido fecal, fibra fisicamente efetiva, processamento de silagens de milho. Professor visitante no Programa de Pós-graduação Lato Sensu das Faculdades Associadas de Uberaba (Fazu) na disciplina exigências nutricionais e formulação de ração para bovinos de leite (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2015 - 2017
Supplementation of dead yeast culture to lactating dairy cows during hot season
Descrição: The supplementation of dairy cows with yeast-based products may increase diet digestibility, plasma niacin concentration, heat dissipation, and lactation performance. Our objective was evaluate the response of Holstein cows in late lactation (234 ± 131 days in milk) to dead yeast culture (YC. 15 g/d, Factor SC, GRASP. Saccharomyces cerevisiae) during Brazilian summer (temperature-humidity index > 68 for 92.2% of time). Thirty-two cows were individually fed a standard total mixed ration for 14 d and treatments Control (CTL) or YC for 35 d, in a covariate adjusted complete randomized block design. Response was evaluated in week 5 or as repeated measures over time. Cows were milked 3 x/d and treatments were orally dosed with yeast or placebo prior to each milking. Plasma niacin evaluated at d 35 of experimental period was 1.50 and 1.66 µg/mL on CTL and YC, respectively. The YC reduced rectal temperature, respiration rate, and skin temperature, evaluated 2 x/wk at 0730, 1500, and 2200 h. The YC tended to increase the sweating rate evaluated weekly at 1500 h. The proportion of cows with rectal temperature ≥ 39.2 oC on CTL and YC was, respectively: 8 and 0% at 0730 h, 52 and 25% at 1500 h, and 35 and 26% at 2200 h. Plasma glucose in weeks 3 and 5 was increased by YC. The total tract apparent digestibility of nutrients, plasma urea-N concentration, ruminal volatile fatty acids profile, urinary allantoin excretion, and ingestion, sorting, and chewing behaviors were not affected by treatment. Cows on YC rejected less feed particles > 19 mm in the morning, in the afternoon were more selective against long feed particles and in favor of particles < 8 mm, and sort against short particles at night. Milk yield was 30.5 kg/d for CTL and 30.2 kg/d for YC. The YC reduced dry matter intake (19.4 vs. 20.3 kg/d) and the digestible organic matter consumed (13.9 vs. 15.6 kg/d). The YC increased the milk to dry matter intake ratio (1.64 vs. 1.50), and tended to increase energy-corrected milk over digestible organic matter intake (1.98 vs. 1.81). The covariate adjusted body weight (648 kg) and body condition score (3.0) did not differ. Milk solids yield and concentration, linear somatic cell score, and milk urea-N also did not differ. The YC increased plasma niacin concentration, body heat loss, and feed efficiency of late lactation dairy cows by reducing intake at a similar milk yield..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (1) / Doutorado: (4) .

Integrantes: Eugenio Faria Barbosa - Integrante / Julia Diane Lima Dias - Integrante / Marcos Neves Pereira - Coordenador / Renata Apocalipse Nogueira Pereira - Integrante / Rayana Brito Silva - Integrante / Tatiane Fernandes - Integrante / Rafael Canonenco Araujo - Integrante / Larissa E. C. Graças - Integrante.
2015 - 2017
Supplementation of lactating dairy cows with strains of live yeast during summer
Descrição: This experiment evaluated if strain type would induce differential response of lactating cows to Saccharomyces cerevisiae supplementation during Brazilian summer (THI > 68 for 86.4 % of time). Thirty Holsteins (169 ± 87 DIM) were milked 3x/d and individually fed on TMR for a 2-week covariate period and blocked by parity (1 vs. > 1) and milk yield before assignment to a treatment for 56 d. Treatments were: strains SC 47 or NCYC 996 (Phileo Lesaffre) or Control (CTL). Pre-planned contrasts were: C1) CTL vs. SC 47 + NCYC 996 and C2) SC 47 vs. NCYC 996. Yeast products (10 g/cow/d) were mixed to a cup of ground corn and top dressed to the TMR in the morning. Viable and non-viable cells/g were: 1.00 x 1010 and 1.03 x 1010 for SC 47 and 1.76 x 1010 and 0.93 x 1010 for NCYC 996, respectively. Yeast products did not affect milk yield (35.8 kg/d, P ≥ 0.69), solids (1.048 protein, 0.953 fat, and 1.572 lactose. kg/d. P ≥ 0.37), and DMI (19.4 kg/d, P ≥ 0.62). Linear SCC scores were 4.94 for CTL (384,000 cells/mL), 4.17 for SC 47 (225,000 cells/mL), and 4.37 for NCYC 996 (258,000 cells/mL) (P < 0.01 for C1). Immune response was evaluated on d -1, 7, and 15 relative to vaccination with an inactivated rabies vaccine on d 35. Total leukocytes and Interleukin-4 (IL-4) increased in all treatments in response to vaccination. Compared to SC 47, NCYC 996 tended to increase IL-4 on d -1 (P = 0.10 for C2) and reduced it on d 15 (P = 0.03 for C2). Gamma-interferon was not affected by treatments (P ≥ 0.19). Total tract apparent digestibility of nutrients and the daily urinary allantoin excretion did not differ (P ≥ 0.20). Yeast increased ingestion time per day and per DMI and meal duration (P ≤ 0.02 for C1). Plasma niacin concentration on d 14 and 56 did not differ (P ≥ 0.62). Rectal temperature at 7 PM tended to be lower on NCYC 996 than SC 47 (39.4 vs. 39.1 oC, P = 0.06 for C2), but respiratory frequency and sweating rate did not change (P ≥ 0.32). Plasma glucose concentration at 0, 2, 4, and 12 h post-feeding did not differ (P ≥ 0.22). Live yeast supplementation reduced milk SCC and affected immunity, but had no impact on animal performance, diet digestibility, and plasma niacin concentration and thermo-regulation..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Eugenio Faria Barbosa - Integrante / Marcos Neves Pereira - Coordenador / Fabiana de Freitas Cardoso - Integrante / Renata Apocalipse Nogueira Pereira - Integrante / Karina Toledo Silva - Integrante / Jenifer C Silva - Integrante / Lucas J Lara - Integrante / Estefan A Garcia - Integrante / Marcos Aronovich - Integrante / Ana Paula Peconick - Integrante.
2015 - Atual
Relationship between total tract starch digestibility and fecal starch concentration in dairy cows
Descrição: Fecal starch concentration has utility to estimate starch digestibility in dairy herds. We evaluated the relationship of total tract starch digestibility and fecal starch concentration in individually fed lactating Holsteins. The data set from 10 experiments conducted at the Better Nature Research Center had 420 cow/observations fed at ad libitum intake. Starch concentration of feces, orts, and feeds were analyzed enzymatically at the Federal University of Lavras laboratory (Hall, 2009). Fecal production was measured by total collection of feces in buckets by trained personal. Feces were collected concurrent to defecation during three 8 h sampling periods and weighed. The second and third sampling periods begun 8 h later than the previous sampling, to avoid a major disturbance to the animals while still representing a 24-h collection period. Fecal aliquots (equal fresh weight basis) were immediately frozen during the collection period and a composite sample was formed. Diets contained 37 to 48% whole plant corn silage in DM and mature finely ground corn grain and/or high moisture corn at 17 to 26% of DM. Cows BW, DMI, and milk yield (MY) during the period of fecal sampling were obtained. Mean±SD (Min-Max) were: BW 667±71 kg (500-860), DMI 21.5±2.9 kg/d (11.9-29.6), MY 33.6±5.9 kg/d (20.9-54.2), DMI/BW 3.34±0.43% (2.0-4.5), MY/DMI 1.57±0.25 (1.01-2.83), fecal starch concentration 5.80±3.05% of DM (0.23-15.77), starch intake 6.210±0.953 kg/d (3.374-8.471), consumed diet starch concentration 29.0±2.7 (22.7-37.7), starch digestibility 94.20±3.18% of intake (84.36-99.75). The correlation coefficient (r) of starch digestibility and fecal starch concentration was (-0.981), higher than with starch intake (0.135), diet starch concentration (0.161), DMI (0.051), DMI/BW (0.094), MY (-0.023), and MY/DMI (-0.089). Based on stepwise procedure, Starch digestibility (% of intake) = 100.14 ? 1.0246 x fecal starch concentration (% of DM) (r2 = 0.9625, P < 0.01). Model R2 was 0.9666 when diet starch concentration was included and 0.9688 when MY was further added (0.15 significance required for entry into the model). Fecal starch concentration was a good predictor of starch digestibility for this data set of cows sampled on similar experimental condition and fed corn based diets..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (1) / Mestrado acadêmico: (3) / Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Eugenio Faria Barbosa - Integrante / Julia Diane Lima Dias - Integrante / Marcos Neves Pereira - Coordenador / Lucas Carneiro de Resende - Integrante / Lucas Parreira de Castro - Integrante / Renata Apocalipse Nogueira Pereira - Integrante / Gustavo Gonçalves de Souza Salvati - Integrante / Luiz Felipe Ferraretto - Integrante.
2014 - 2017
Response of lactating dairy cows to monensin supplementation of diets differing in ruminal acidogenic capacity
Descrição: The response of dairy cows to monensin can interact with diet composition. The response of lactating cows to monensin supplementation of diets differing in concentration and rumen fermentability starch was evaluated. Twenty-eight Holsteins (157 ± 76 DIM) were individually fed a standard TMR for 3 weeks and monensin (MON. 300 mg/d) or control (CTL) for 9 weeks, in a covariate adjusted randomized block design. A low acidogenic diet (LOW. 25.8% of starch in DM) was offered from d 1 to 35 and a high acidogenic diet (HIGH. 30 % of starch in DM) from d 36 to 63. HIGH was formulated by replacing the whole cottonseed and finely ground mature corn by an iso-nitrogenous mixture of soybean meal and rehydrated and ensiled ground mature corn. Data were collected daily or after adaptation to LOW and HIGH, and were analyzed as repeated measures with Mixed of SAS. The mean square for cow nested within treatment (MON vs. CTL) was the error term for the treatment effect. Digestible OM intake (DOMI) was increased by HIGH diet (14.7 vs. 14.3 kg/d), and decreased for MON supplementation (14.2 vs. 15.2 kg/d). Milk yield did not respond to MON (32.3 kg/d). MON reduced DMI and increased Milk/DMI, ECM/DMI, and ECM/DOMI only when HIGH was fed. Weekly plasma glucose concentration was increased by MON and the response interacted similarly with week/diet. MON reduced the A/P ratio in rumen fluid in both diets (2.43 vs. 1.81) and HIGH reduced ruminal pH and plasma D-lactate was increased in HIGH diets and decreased by MON supplementation. HIGH diets increased protozoa concentration. MON reduced total tract NDF digestibility more in LOW (52.1 vs. 41.3 % of intake) than in HIGH (57.0 vs. 52.0 % of intake). The daily urinary allantoin excretion did not respond to MON, neither PUN at 0, 1.5, and 3 h post feeding. MON induced lower degree of refusal of long feed particles and of preferential intake of short particles in the afternoon than CTL. Ingestion time (min/d and min/kg of DMI) and the number of daily meals were reduced by HIGH. HIGH increased pCO2, HCO3-, total CO2, and base excess of jugular blood and tended to reduce blood pH. HIGH increased the concentrations and yield of short-chain FA (C < 16:0), and reduced the concentrations of long chain FA (C ≥ 18:0) in milk. MON did not affect the concentrations and production of short, medium, and long chain FA in milk. MON reduced the odd and branched-chain fatty acids yield (C15:0 iso plus C17:0 iso) and the concentration C13:0 iso in milk. The positive effect of MON on increased in feed efficiency occurred only when ruminally available starch was increased in the diet..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (2) / Mestrado acadêmico: (3) / Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Eugenio Faria Barbosa - Integrante / Julia Diane Lima Dias - Integrante / Marcos Neves Pereira - Coordenador / Lucas Carneiro de Resende - Integrante / Wesley de Rezende Silva - Integrante / Lucas Parreira de Castro - Integrante / Renata Apocalipse Nogueira Pereira - Integrante / Beatriz Ferreira Carvalho - Integrante / Marcio Machado Ladeira - Integrante / Carla Luiza Silva Avila - Integrante.
2014 - 2016
Supplementation of palm oil to lactating dairy cows fed a high fat diet during summer
Descrição: Dairy cows subjected to heat stress can benefit from fat supplementation. We evaluated the response of lactating cows to the supplementation of a basal diet containing fat from whole cottonseed and roasted soybeans [3.2% of DM as ether extract (EE) from oil seeds] with two palm oil sources (1.1% of DM as EE from supplements). Thirty cows were fed a standard diet for 14 d and were assigned to a treatment for 63 d, in a covariate adjusted randomized block design with repeated measures over time. Treatments were: Control (CTL), fractionated palm oil (F, 73.5% of fatty acids as C16:0 and 14.7% as C18:1), and calcium salt of palm oil (S, 41.5% of fatty acids as C16:0 and 38.4% as C18:1). Pre-planned contrasts were: CTL vs. (F + S) and F vs. S. The EE concentration of the diet was 7.3% of DM in CTL and 8.4% in F and S. The temperature humidity index was above 68 for 17.1 h/d during the experiment. Palm oil reduced rectal temperature (P < 0.02) and respiratory frequency (P = 0.05), but had no effect on sudoresis (P = 0.97) and jugular blood acid-base balance (P > 0.31). Rectal temperature at 2 PM was 38.9oC for S and 39.1oC for F (P = 0.02). Palm oil increased milk yield (31.0 vs. 30.1 kg/d, P = 0.02) and reduced DMI (19.2 vs. 19.9 kg/d, P = 0.01), increasing feed efficiency (1.65 vs. 1.54, P = 0.01), and S tended do reduce DMI (P = 0.07) and increase feed efficiency (P = 0.01) more than F. Secretions of milk fat and lactose were increased by 47 g/d (P = 0.04) and 37 g/d (P = 0.08) with palm oil, respectively. Plasma glucose concentration was similar among treatments (P = 0.63), as well as total tract apparent digestibility of EE (P = 0.97) and NDF (P = 0.43), the intake of TDN (P = 0.17), and BW (P = 0.87). The acetate to propionate ratio in ruminal fluid was 2.39 for F and 1.98 for S (P = 0.05), suggesting that palm oil sources differed in ruminal inertness. Ingestion time/DMI was 17.3 min for S and 14.9 min for F (P= 0.01). Lactating cows fed a diet rich in fat from oilseeds had increased feed efficiency and reduced signs of heat stress when fat from palm oil was supplemented..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (3) Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Eugenio Faria Barbosa - Integrante / Ricardo Peixoto de Melo - Integrante / Marcos Neves Pereira - Coordenador / Fabiana de Freitas Cardoso - Integrante / Lucas Parreira de Castro - Integrante / Renata Apocalipse Nogueira Pereira - Integrante / Leandra Queiroz de Melo - Integrante / Rayana Brito Silva - Integrante.
2014 - 2015
Response of dairy cows to selenized yeast supplementation
Descrição: As leveduras são organismos do grupo dos fungos que fermentam carboidratos, a levedura mais comumente utilizada em nutrição de ruminantes é a Saccharomyces cerevisiae. As leveduras também são consumidoras de oxigênio (O2) presente no rúmen, favorecendo os microrganismos que preferem um ambiente com ausência de oxigênio. Objetivo deste experimento foi avaliar o desempenho dos animais quanto à produção a composição do leite, o consumo de matéria seca, a digestibilidade dos nutrientes no trato digestivo total, o comportamento alimentar ao longo do dia e incorporação do selênio no leite e nos seus derivados, em dietas contendo levedura selenizada. Vinte e oito vacas Holandesas foram utilizadas, em estágio de lactação superior a 60 dias pós-parto, e foram alocadas a dieta de padronização por 21 dias, as variáveis mensuradas na última semana foram utilizadas como covariável no modelo de análise estatística. Os animais foram blocados em grupos de dois animais com base na ordem de parto e produção de leite, dias em lactação e peso. Os dados foram analisados pelo proc. Mixed do SAS, dentro de cada bloco os animais foram alocados aleatoriamente a um tratamento, por um período de comparação de 9 semanas, delineados em blocos ao acaso ajustado para covariável e com estrutura de medidas repetidas no tempo. As respostas foram mensuradas na terceira e nona semana. Os tratamentos foram Selenito de Sódio vs. Levedura Selenizada oferecidos por dosagem oral de 5 mg de selênio por vaca 2 vezes ao dia. Foram avaliados 2 períodos, o primeiro com baixo amido, com teores dietéticos de 25 % com base na MS, foi da primeira a quinta semana, e o segundo período com alto amido, com teores dietéticos de 30 % com base na MS, foi da sexta a nona semana..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (2) / Mestrado acadêmico: (3) / Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Eugenio Faria Barbosa - Integrante / Julia Diane Lima Dias - Integrante / Ricardo Peixoto de Melo - Integrante / Ozana de Fátima Zacaroni - Integrante / Marcos Neves Pereira - Coordenador / Fabiana de Freitas Cardoso - Integrante / Lucas Carneiro de Resende - Integrante.
2004 - 2008
Avaliação econômica dos processos de seleção de bovinos da raça nelore
Descrição: A seleção de bovinos para produção de carne é realizada no Brasil através de dois métodos. Um deles é através de julgamentos do exterior, e o outro é através de avaliações genéticas, com obtenção de Desvios Esperados nas Progênies. O presente projeto pretende: . Verificar as tendências genéticas dos animais selecionados em julgamentos; . Apontar as tendências dos preços de venda dos animais de seleção de acordo com sua superioridade genética, comparando os tipos indicados como superiores pelos programas de melhoramento com aqueles indicados pelos julgamentos; . Estimar o desempenho econômico, em nível de rebanhos comerciais, dos descendentes dos animais indicados como superiores pelos programas de melhoramento e daqueles indicados pelos julgamentos, comparando esses resultados..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (2) / Especialização: (1) .

Integrantes: Eugenio Faria Barbosa - Integrante / João Cláudio do Carmo Paneto - Coordenador / Eustáquio Resende Bittar - Integrante / José Eduardo do Val - Integrante / Raysildo Barbosa Lôbo - Integrante / Carina Diniz Rocha - Integrante / José Bento Sterman Ferraz - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico - Bolsa / Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de Minas Gerais - Auxílio financeiro / Universidade de Uberaba - Bolsa.
